name: SID 27 Security Access - Production Grade ECU Test Suite
description: Comprehensive production-grade test suite for UDS Service ID 27 (SecurityAccess) based on ISO 14229-1:2020 Section 9.3. Designed for real ECU testing in automotive environments. Covers all positive/negative response conditions, timing constraints, service interactions, error recovery, and multi-level security workflows.

requests.description: === SECTION A: SESSION VALIDATION TESTS ===
TC-A01: Reset to Default Session for isolation
TC-A02: Request Seed Level 1 in DEFAULT Session - Expect NRC 0x7F (serviceNotSupportedInActiveSession)
TC-A03: Request Seed Level 2 in DEFAULT Session - Expect NRC 0x7F
TC-A04: Request Seed Level 3 in DEFAULT Session - Expect NRC 0x7F
TC-A05: Switch to EXTENDED Diagnostic Session
TC-A06: Request Seed Level 1 in EXTENDED Session - Success (seed returned)
TC-A07: Switch back to DEFAULT Session (resets security state)
TC-A08: Switch to PROGRAMMING Session
TC-A09: Request Seed Level 1 in PROGRAMMING Session - Success
TC-A10: Request Seed Level 2 in PROGRAMMING Session - Success
=== SECTION B: SECURITY LEVEL VALIDATION ===
TC-B01: Reset to Default Session
TC-B02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-B03: Request Seed Level 1 (0x01) - Success
TC-B04: Request Seed Level 2 (0x03) - Success
TC-B05: Request Seed Level 3 (0x05) - Success
TC-B06: Request Seed Level 4 (0x07) - Expect NRC 0x12 (subFunctionNotSupported)
TC-B07: Request Seed Level 5 (0x09) - Expect NRC 0x12
TC-B08: Request Seed Level 63 (0x7D) - Expect NRC 0x12
TC-B09: Request Seed Max Level 64 (0x7F) - Expect NRC 0x12
=== SECTION C: SUB-FUNCTION RANGE VALIDATION ===
TC-C01: Reset to Default Session
TC-C02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-C03: Sub-function 0x00 (reserved) - Expect NRC 0x31 (requestOutOfRange)
TC-C04: Sub-function 0x02 (even for seed request) - Expect NRC 0x31 or 0x22
TC-C05: Sub-function 0x04 (even without prior seed) - Expect NRC 0x22 or 0x31
TC-C06: Sub-function 0x80 (suppressPosRsp bit set) - Valid for seed request
TC-C07: Sub-function 0x81 (>0x7F with suppress bit) - Expect NRC 0x31
TC-C08: Sub-function 0xFF (max invalid) - Expect NRC 0x31 or 0x12
=== SECTION D: SUCCESSFUL UNLOCK FLOW (HAPPY PATH) ===
TC-D01: Reset to Default Session
TC-D02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-D03: Request Seed Level 1 - Store returned seed
TC-D04: Send Key Level 1 (Correct Key: 0xB76EA677) - Expect 0x67 0x02 (Unlocked)
TC-D05: Write Protected DID 0xF190 (VIN) - Verify security enables access
TC-D06: Read back DID 0xF190 to verify write succeeded
TC-D07: TesterPresent to keep session alive
=== SECTION E: ALREADY UNLOCKED HANDLING ===
TC-E01: Reset to Default Session
TC-E02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-E03: Request Seed Level 1
TC-E04: Send Correct Key (0xB76EA677) - Unlock Level 1
TC-E05: Request Seed Level 1 AGAIN - Expect all-zero seed (0x67 0x01 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00)
TC-E06: Request Seed Level 2 (different level) - Expect non-zero seed
TC-E07: Request Seed Level 1 again - Still all-zeros (Level 1 still unlocked)
=== SECTION F: INVALID KEY HANDLING ===
TC-F01: Reset to Default Session
TC-F02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-F03: Request Seed Level 1
TC-F04: Send WRONG Key (all zeros) - Expect NRC 0x35 (invalidKey)
TC-F05: Attempt Protected Write - Expect NRC 0x33 (Still locked)
TC-F06: Wait 11s then Request Seed again - Success (delay expired)
TC-F07: Send another wrong key (0xFF pattern) - Expect NRC 0x35
=== SECTION G: SEQUENCE ERROR VALIDATION ===
TC-G01: Reset to Default Session
TC-G02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-G03: Request Seed Level 1 (0x01)
TC-G04: Send Key for Level 2 (0x04 instead of 0x02) - Expect NRC 0x24 (requestSequenceError)
TC-G05: Wait delay, Request Seed Level 2 (0x03)
TC-G06: Send Key for Level 1 (0x02) - Expect NRC 0x24 (wrong level)
TC-G07: Request Seed Level 1
TC-G08: Send Key for Level 3 (0x06) - Expect NRC 0x24
=== SECTION H: MESSAGE LENGTH VALIDATION ===
TC-H01: Reset to Default Session
TC-H02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-H03: Request Seed Level 1
TC-H04: Send Key with 0 bytes - Expect NRC 0x13 (incorrectMessageLengthOrInvalidFormat)
TC-H05: Request Seed again
TC-H06: Send Key with 1 byte - Expect NRC 0x13
TC-H07: Request Seed again
TC-H08: Send Key with 2 bytes - Expect NRC 0x13
TC-H09: Request Seed again
TC-H10: Send Key with 3 bytes - Expect NRC 0x13
TC-H11: Request Seed again
TC-H12: Send Correct Key with 4 bytes - Success
TC-H13: Request Seed (already unlocked - expect zeros)
=== SECTION I: ATTEMPT COUNTER AND LOCKOUT ===
TC-I01: Reset to Default Session (clears attempt counter)
TC-I02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-I03: Request Seed (Attempt 1)
TC-I04: Invalid Key Attempt 1 - Expect NRC 0x35 (Counter=1)
TC-I05: Reset to Default (wait 11s for delay) - Counter persists or resets based on ECU
TC-I06: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-I07: Request Seed (Attempt 2)
TC-I08: Invalid Key Attempt 2 - Expect NRC 0x35 (Counter=2)
TC-I09: Reset to Default (wait 11s)
TC-I10: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-I11: Request Seed (Attempt 3)
TC-I12: Invalid Key Attempt 3 - Expect NRC 0x35 (Counter=3 - LOCKOUT TRIGGERED)
TC-I13: Request Seed after lockout - Expect NRC 0x36 (exceededNumberOfAttempts)
TC-I14: Try different level during lockout - Expect NRC 0x36
TC-I15: Reset to Default (may not clear lockout - ECU dependent)
=== SECTION J: DELAY TIMER ENFORCEMENT ===
TC-J01: Reset to Default Session
TC-J02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-J03: Request Seed
TC-J04: Send Invalid Key - Starts 10s delay timer
TC-J05: Request Seed immediately (1s later) - Expect NRC 0x37 (requiredTimeDelayNotExpired)
TC-J06: Request Seed 3s later - Still NRC 0x37
TC-J07: Request Seed 5s later - Still NRC 0x37
TC-J08: Request Seed 9s later - Still NRC 0x37 (boundary test)
TC-J09: Request Seed 11s later - Success (delay expired)
TC-J10: Send correct key - Unlock successful
=== SECTION K: SEED TIMEOUT VALIDATION ===
TC-K01: Reset to Default Session
TC-K02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-K03: Request Seed - Seed valid for 5 seconds
TC-K04: Send Correct Key 7s later - Expect NRC 0x22 (conditionsNotCorrect - seed expired)
TC-K05: Wait delay, Request new Seed
TC-K06: Send Correct Key within 2s - Success (within timeout)
TC-K07: Reset to Default
TC-K08: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-K09: Request Seed - Test boundary at exactly 5s
TC-K10: Send Correct Key at 5.5s (just over timeout) - Expect NRC 0x22
=== SECTION L: SESSION CHANGE SECURITY RESET ===
TC-L01: Reset to Default Session
TC-L02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-L03: Request Seed Level 1
TC-L04: Send Correct Key - Unlock Level 1
TC-L05: Verify Protected Write works
TC-L06: Switch to DEFAULT Session - Security LOST
TC-L07: Attempt Protected Write - Expect NRC 0x7F (service not supported)
TC-L08: Enter EXTENDED Session again
TC-L09: Attempt Protected Write - Expect NRC 0x33 (security access denied)
TC-L10: Request Seed Level 1 - Must re-unlock
TC-L11: Send Correct Key - Re-unlock Level 1
TC-L12: Protected Write - Now works again
TC-L13: Switch to PROGRAMMING Session - Security LOST AGAIN
TC-L14: Attempt Protected Write - Expect NRC 0x33
=== SECTION M: CONDITIONS NOT CORRECT ===
TC-M01: Reset to Default Session
TC-M02: Send Key WITHOUT session change - Expect NRC 0x7F (wrong session)
TC-M03: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-M04: Send Key WITHOUT seed request - Expect NRC 0x22 (conditionsNotCorrect)
TC-M05: Send Key Level 2 WITHOUT seed - Expect NRC 0x22
TC-M06: Send Key Level 3 WITHOUT seed - Expect NRC 0x22
=== SECTION N: MULTI-LEVEL SECURITY ===
TC-N01: Reset to Default Session
TC-N02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-N03: Request Seed Level 1
TC-N04: Send Correct Key - Unlock Level 1
TC-N05: Request Seed Level 2 - New seed (Level 2 still locked)
TC-N06: Send Correct Key - Unlock Level 2
TC-N07: Request Seed Level 1 - All-zeros (still unlocked)
TC-N08: Request Seed Level 2 - All-zeros (still unlocked)
TC-N09: Request Seed Level 3 - New seed (Level 3 still locked)
=== SECTION O: TESTER PRESENT KEEP-ALIVE ===
TC-O01: Reset to Default Session
TC-O02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-O03: Request Seed Level 1
TC-O04: Send Correct Key - Unlock
TC-O05: TesterPresent (3s) - Reset S3 timer
TC-O06: TesterPresent (6s) - Keep session alive
TC-O07: TesterPresent (9s) - Maintain security
TC-O08: Protected Write (12s) - Verify still unlocked
TC-O09: TesterPresent with suppressPosRsp (0x80)
TC-O10: Protected Write (18s) - Still works
=== SECTION P: SERVICE INTERACTION - DTC CLEAR ===
TC-P01: Reset to Default Session
TC-P02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-P03: Clear All DTCs (0x14) without security - May require NRC 0x33 or succeed (ECU dependent)
TC-P04: Request Seed Level 1
TC-P05: Send Correct Key - Unlock Level 1
TC-P06: Clear All DTCs with security - Success
TC-P07: Read DTCs - Verify cleared
=== SECTION Q: SERVICE INTERACTION - ROUTINE CONTROL ===
TC-Q01: Reset to Default Session
TC-Q02: Enter PROGRAMMING Session
TC-Q03: Start Routine 0x0203 (Check Preconditions) without security
TC-Q04: Request Seed Level 2 (Programming level)
TC-Q05: Send Correct Key - Unlock Level 2
TC-Q06: Start Routine 0x0203 with security - Success
TC-Q07: Get Routine Results
=== SECTION R: ERROR RECOVERY SCENARIOS ===
TC-R01: Reset to Default Session
TC-R02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-R03: Request Seed Level 1
TC-R04: Invalid key - Trigger error state
TC-R05: Recovery Step 1 - Reset to Default after delay
TC-R06: Recovery Step 2 - Re-enter EXTENDED
TC-R07: Recovery Step 3 - Request fresh seed
TC-R08: Recovery Step 4 - Send CORRECT key (0xB76EA677)
TC-R09: Recovery Verification - Protected operation succeeds
=== SECTION S: SEED UNIQUENESS VERIFICATION ===
TC-S01: Reset to Default Session
TC-S02: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-S03: Request Seed #1 - Record value
TC-S04: Reset to Default (discard seed)
TC-S05: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-S06: Request Seed #2 - Should be DIFFERENT from #1
TC-S07: Reset to Default
TC-S08: Enter EXTENDED Session
TC-S09: Request Seed #3 - Verify random/unique
=== SECTION T: FINAL CLEANUP ===
TC-T01: Final Reset to Default Session
TC-T02: Read VIN to verify system state
TC-T03: Read DTC Count
TC-T04: Final TesterPresent

metadata.author: UDS Simulator - Production ECU Testing
metadata.description: Production-grade test suite for SID 27 (SecurityAccess) suitable for real automotive ECU validation. Covers all ISO 14229-1:2020 Section 9.3 requirements including positive response conditions, all 9 NRCs, timing constraints, service interactions, and error recovery procedures.
testSections: I: Attempt Counter and Lockout (15 tests)
L: Session Change Security Reset (14 tests)
P: Service Interaction - DTC Clear (7 tests)
Q: Service Interaction - Routine Control (7 tests)

notes:
Production-Grade Test Suite v2.0.0 for SID 27 (SecurityAccess)

=== POSITIVE RESPONSE CONDITIONS ===
• Session: Must be in Extended (0x03) or Programming (0x02) session
• Seed Request: Valid odd sub-function (0x01, 0x03, 0x05 for levels 1-3)
• Seed Response: 0x67 + SubFunc + 4-byte random seed (or all-zeros if already unlocked)
• Key Send: Even sub-function = SeedSubFunc + 1, with 4-byte correct key
• Key Response: 0x67 + SubFunc (no data = successfully unlocked)
• Already Unlocked: Returns all-zero seed, no key needed

=== NEGATIVE RESPONSE CONDITIONS ===
• NRC 0x12: Sub-function not supported (Level 4+, unsupported levels)
• NRC 0x13: Incorrect message length (key != 4 bytes)
• NRC 0x22: Conditions not correct (no seed, seed expired, wrong session)
• NRC 0x24: Request sequence error (key sub-func mismatch)
• NRC 0x31: Request out of range (0x00, invalid sub-func values)
• NRC 0x35: Invalid key (wrong calculation)
• NRC 0x36: Exceeded number of attempts (3 failed attempts = lockout)
• NRC 0x37: Required time delay not expired (10s delay after invalid key)
• NRC 0x7F: Service not supported in active session (Default session)

=== TIMING CONSTRAINTS ===
• Seed validity: 5 seconds from generation
• Delay timer: 10 seconds after invalid key attempt
• S3 session timeout: 5 seconds without TesterPresent
• Attempt counter reset: Power cycle or extended wait

=== SERVICE INTERACTIONS ===
• SID 0x2E WriteDataByIdentifier: Requires security for protected DIDs
• SID 0x31 RoutineControl: Protected routines need appropriate level
• SID 0x14 ClearDTC: May require Level 1 security
• SID 0x34 RequestDownload: Requires Level 2 in Programming session
• SID 0x3E TesterPresent: Resets S3 timer, maintains session/security

=== ERROR RECOVERY PROCEDURES ===
• After NRC 0x35: Wait 10s delay, request new seed, retry with correct key
• After NRC 0x36: Power cycle ECU or wait lockout period (10+ minutes)
• After NRC 0x22: Request fresh seed before sending key
• Session lost: Re-enter session, re-unlock, retry operation

This test suite validates all aspects required for production ECU deployment in automotive environments per ISO 14229-1:2020 Section 9.3.
